issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
As described above, the iOS app can crash if we reassign annotations via {{setAnnotations}}, e.g. after a timeout or network call. 

Sample code (thanks [~michael] for reporting on Slack): 
https://gist.github.com/hansemannn/7bd2bc68d28637e58fd384253dc86a29

Likely caused by [this PR|https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.map/pull/212], but not a blocker or too critical as it can be workarounded by removing the old ones first. Still an issue that should be addressed.
fields.summary: iOS: Ti.Map - App crashes when re-assigning annotations with clustering enabled

comments.body:
PR: https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.map/pull/220

Test-Case above. Doing the master/7_0_X PR once the Ti.Map PR is approved.

Closing ticket as ti.map 3.0.2 is correctly downloaded with the SDK. 
I checked this with SDK 7.0.2.v20180124113923.
